intro: Maesa pisocarpa, commonly known as the red-fruited maesa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped white flowers. Its fruit is a bright red, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Maesa pisocarpa is often found in lowland and montane forests, thriving in humid, shaded environments.
